intro: Zosterophyllanthos cordifolius, commonly known as the heart-leaf zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species with unique botanical features. It belongs to the order Zosterophyllophyta, which includes some of the earliest known land plants. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with heart-shaped leaves and a simple, branching structure. Its reproductive structures are primitive, resembling those of early vascular plants. This species provides valuable insights into the evolutionary transition from aquatic to terrestrial life in plant evolution.
